can't reproduce it what version are are you on oh no so we realize that you know
version numbers are really important for tracking issues and in Mobile it's especially important because we're playing a game of cat and mouse against
all these different vendors so we're working uh with software that's being shipped by Apple being shipped by Google
being shipped by Microsoft um being shipped by all these different vendors and and when they ship well they usually
have long beta Cycles like everyone here got to enjoy Android 4.0 beta right no

so we realized that not shipping new versions was probably the wrong thing to
do and then we as all software developers decided to do exactly the opposite so we started shipping all the
time and we started shipping versions as quickly as possible um because we have so many different platforms we weren't
able to ship all these different versions super fast so we we sort of settled on a one-month release schedule
so once a month we ship a a minor version um so we do now I think we're on 2.1 and 2.2 will come out at the end of
October um and then if we have any bugs along the way we'll ship patches as quickly as we can and this is really
worked to our favor so in IOS 5.1 um Apple broke local storage in the web
browser um they said that the spec was ambiguous um so local storage sometimes will just delete the cash so it's

which is cool but even better we didn't have this sort of obsession with the features that we had for that particular
